verses.translationEnglish: Read in the name of your Lord who created
verses.translationUrdu: پڑھو اپنے رب کے نام سے جس نے پیدا کیا
verses.translationPashto: د خپل رب په نوم ولولئ چې هغه یې پیدا کړي دي
verses.modernRelevance: In our information age, this verse reminds us that true knowledge begins with divine consciousness and ethical responsibility.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The mystic reads not just with eyes but with the heart, seeing divine signs in every particle of existence.

wordAnalysis.significance: The first divine command emphasizing the importance of knowledge
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ق-ر-أ meaning to read, recite, or proclaim

wordAnalysis.significance: Indicates that all knowledge should begin with divine consciousness
wordAnalysis.etymology: Preposition + noun, meaning 'with the name'

wordAnalysis.significance: Personal relationship with the Creator and Sustainer
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ر-ب-ب meaning to nurture, sustain, and guide
wordAnalysis.grammatical: Possessive noun with second person suffix

wordAnalysis.significance: Relative pronoun emphasizing God's active role
wordAnalysis.etymology: Definite relative pronoun

wordAnalysis.significance: Emphasizes God as the ultimate source of all existence
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root خ-ل-ق meaning to create, form, or bring into being

verses.translationEnglish: Created man from a clinging substance
verses.translationUrdu: انسان کو جمے ہوئے خون سے پیدا کیا
verses.translationPashto: انسان یې د وینې د ټوپ څخه پیدا کړ
verses.modernRelevance: Modern embryology confirms this 1400-year-old description of human development stages.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The spiritual seeker recognizes that from humble material origins emerges the potential for divine consciousness.

wordAnalysis.significance: Repetition emphasizes the creative power of Allah
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root خ-ل-ق meaning to create

wordAnalysis.significance: Refers to all of humanity without distinction
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root أ-ن-س meaning to be sociable or familiar

wordAnalysis.significance: Indicates the source or origin
wordAnalysis.etymology: Preposition indicating origin

wordAnalysis.significance: Describes the embryonic stage of human development
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ع-ل-ق meaning to cling or adhere

verses.translationEnglish: Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous
verses.translationUrdu: پڑھو اور تمہارا رب سب سے زیادہ کریم ہے
verses.translationPashto: ولولئ او ستاسو رب خورا ډیر کریم دی
verses.modernRelevance: Encourages generous sharing of knowledge and resources in our interconnected world.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The Divine Generosity flows endlessly to those who open their hearts to receive and share wisdom.

wordAnalysis.significance: Second command to read, emphasizing persistence
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ق-ر-أ meaning to read

wordAnalysis.significance: Conjunction connecting the command with divine attribute
wordAnalysis.etymology: Coordinating conjunction

wordAnalysis.significance: Personal relationship with the Creator
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ر-ب-ب meaning to nurture

wordAnalysis.significance: Superlative form emphasizing infinite divine generosity
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ك-ر-م meaning to be generous or noble

verses.translationUrdu: جس نے قلم کے ذریعے تعلیم دی
verses.translationPashto: هغه چې د قلم په وسیله یې زده کړه ورکړه
verses.modernRelevance: Encompasses all forms of written communication, from ancient scripts to digital technology.
benefits: Honors the sacred act of writing
verses.sufiInterpretation: The cosmic pen writes the destiny of souls through divine inspiration and guidance.

wordAnalysis.significance: Continues describing Allah's attributes
wordAnalysis.etymology: Definite relative pronoun

wordAnalysis.significance: Emphasizes Allah as the ultimate teacher
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ع-ل-م meaning to know or teach
wordAnalysis.grammatical: Perfect verb, third person singular, intensive form

wordAnalysis.significance: Highlights the importance of writing in preserving knowledge
wordAnalysis.etymology: Preposition + definite noun from root ق-ل-م

verses.translationEnglish: Taught man that which he knew not
verses.translationUrdu: انسان کو وہ علم دیا جو وہ نہیں جانتا تھا
verses.translationPashto: انسان ته یې هغه پوهه ورکړه چې هغه یې نه پوهیده
verses.modernRelevance: Encourages all forms of research, innovation, and discovery in service of humanity.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The infinite ocean of divine knowledge reveals itself gradually to the sincere seeker.

wordAnalysis.significance: Repetition emphasizes the continuous nature of divine teaching
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ع-ل-م meaning to teach
wordAnalysis.grammatical: Perfect verb, third person singular, intensive form

wordAnalysis.significance: Direct object of divine teaching
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root أ-ن-س meaning to be sociable

wordAnalysis.significance: Indicates the vast scope of knowledge
wordAnalysis.etymology: Relative pronoun

wordAnalysis.significance: Negation particle for past actions
wordAnalysis.etymology: Negative particle

wordAnalysis.significance: Emphasizes the expansion of human knowledge
wordAnalysis.etymology: From root ع-ل-م meaning to know

verses.translationUrdu: ہرگز نہیں! بے شک انسان سرکشی کرتا ہے
verses.translationPashto: نه! بې شکه انسان سرکشي کوي
verses.modernRelevance: Warns against the arrogance that can come with knowledge and power in modern society.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The ego's tendency to claim independence from divine guidance leads to spiritual transgression.

verses.translationUrdu: کیونکہ وہ اپنے آپ کو بے نیاز سمجھتا ہے
verses.translationPashto: ځکه چې هغه ځان ته بې نیازه ګوري
verses.modernRelevance: Addresses the illusion of self-sufficiency in our materialistic age.
verses.sufiInterpretation: True wealth lies in recognizing one's complete dependence on the Divine Beloved.

verses.translationEnglish: Indeed, to your Lord is the return
verses.translationUrdu: بے شک تیرے رب ہی کی طرف واپسی ہے
verses.translationPashto: بې شکه ستاسو رب ته بیرته راستنیدل دي
verses.modernRelevance: Reminds us of accountability in all our actions and decisions.
verses.sufiInterpretation: Every breath is a step on the journey back to the Divine Source.

verses.translationEnglish: Have you seen the one who forbids
verses.translationUrdu: کیا تو نے اس شخص کو دیکھا جو منع کرتا ہے
verses.translationPashto: ایا تاسو هغه سړي ولیدل چې منع کوي
verses.modernRelevance: Questions those who oppose the spread of knowledge and spiritual growth.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The ego often forbids the soul from its natural inclination toward divine remembrance.

verses.translationUrdu: ایک بندے کو جب وہ نماز پڑھتا ہے
verses.translationPashto: یو بنده کله چې هغه لمونځ کوي
verses.modernRelevance: Defends the fundamental right to worship and spiritual practice.
verses.sufiInterpretation: Prayer is the soul's natural conversation with its Beloved Creator.

verses.translationEnglish: Have you seen if he is upon guidance
verses.translationUrdu: کیا تو نے دیکھا اگر وہ ہدایت پر ہے
verses.translationPashto: ایا تاسو ولیدل که هغه د لارښوونې پر دی
verses.modernRelevance: Challenges us to recognize and respect those who are truly guided.
verses.sufiInterpretation: True guidance manifests in the heart as divine light illuminating the spiritual path.

verses.translationUrdu: یا تقویٰ کا حکم دیتا ہے
verses.modernRelevance: Honors those who promote ethical behavior and God-consciousness.
verses.sufiInterpretation: Taqwa is the protective shield of the heart against all that distances from Allah.

verses.translationEnglish: Have you seen if he denies and turns away
verses.translationUrdu: کیا تو نے دیکھا اگر اس نے جھٹلایا اور منہ موڑا
verses.translationPashto: ایا تاسو ولیدل که هغه دروغ ویلي او مخ یې اړولی
verses.modernRelevance: Describes the attitude of those who reject truth and guidance.
verses.sufiInterpretation: Turning away from divine guidance darkens the heart and distances the soul from its true nature.

verses.translationEnglish: Does he not know that Allah sees
verses.translationUrdu: کیا وہ نہیں جانتا کہ اللہ دیکھ رہا ہے
verses.translationPashto: ایا هغه نه پوهیږي چې الله ګوري
verses.modernRelevance: Reminds us of divine omniscience in our age of surveillance and privacy concerns.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The divine gaze is not surveillance but the loving attention of the Beloved watching over the beloved.

verses.arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ
verses.transliteration: Kalla la'in lam yantahi la-nasfa'an bin-nasiya
verses.translationEnglish: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock
verses.translationUrdu: ہرگز نہیں! اگر وہ باز نہ آیا تو ہم اسے پیشانی کے بالوں سے پکڑیں گے
verses.translationPashto: نه! که هغه ودرېږي نو موږ به یې د تندي د ویښتانو څخه ونیسو
verses.modernRelevance: Warns of consequences for persistent opposition to truth and justice.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The forelock represents the ego's pride, which must be humbled before divine majesty.

verses.modernRelevance: Describes the characteristics of those who persistently oppose truth.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The forehead that does not touch the ground in prostration becomes a symbol of arrogance and falsehood.

verses.translationEnglish: Then let him call his associates
verses.translationUrdu: پھر وہ اپنی مجلس کو بلائے
verses.modernRelevance: Challenges the reliance on worldly support against divine authority.
verses.sufiInterpretation: No assembly of the ego can stand against the overwhelming power of divine truth.

verses.translationEnglish: We will call the angels of punishment
verses.translationUrdu: ہم عذاب کے فرشتوں کو بلائیں گے
verses.translationPashto: موږ به د عذاب پرښتې وغواړو
verses.modernRelevance: Reminds us that divine justice will ultimately prevail.
verses.sufiInterpretation: The angels of divine justice are always ready to execute the will of the Most Just.

verses.translationEnglish: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allah]
verses.translationUrdu: ہرگز نہیں! اس کی اطاعت نہ کر اور سجدہ کر اور قریب ہو جا
verses.translationPashto: نه! د هغه اطاعت مه کوه او سجده وکړه او نږدې شه
verses.modernRelevance: Provides the ultimate solution: reject falsehood, worship Allah, and seek closeness to Him.
verses.sufiInterpretation: In prostration, the seeker finds the closest point to the Divine Presence, where all veils are lifted.
